title: Ticket #3669: HOOK_JOB_EXIT always killed immediately by condor_starter
description:
There's a bug in condor_starter which affects the execution of a HOOK_JOB_EXIT. The bug causes the starter to terminate the hook immediately. If a job terminates the starter calls the function ShutdownGraceful in condor_starter.V6.1/baseStarter.cpp:

The code piece 

if (!jobRunning) {
dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG,"Got ShutdownGraceful when no jobs running.\n");
this->allJobsDone();
return 1;
}

is erroneous as it reports that both job AND all hooks terminated when it returns 1. Returning 1 leads to immediate termination of the condor_starter and kills all running hooks. The correct version reads: 

if (!jobRunning) {
dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG,"Got ShutdownGraceful when no jobs running.\n");
return (this->allJobsDone());
}

allJobsDone will return 0 if some hooks or other tasks are still running causing condor_starter to wait until they finished their work.

I applied the fix to my version of condor and can confirm that it works.

Here's the patch: 

--- src/condor_starter.V6.1/baseStarter.cpp
+++ src/condor_starter.V6.1/baseStarter.cpp
@@ -365,12 +365,11 @@
        }
        ShuttingDown = TRUE;
        if (!jobRunning) {
                dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG,
                                "Got ShutdownGraceful when no jobs running.\n");
-               this->allJobsDone();
-               return 1;
+               return (this->allJobsDone());
        }
        return 0;
 }

Update Dec. 2013: Turns out that my patch fixes the case of normal termination (i.e. the job ends on its own) but not the case wher a user aborts the job. In this case again the hook gets right after it has been started. This other bug is in jic_shadow.cpp as it seems. Here's a patch solving this problem as well: 

--- src/condor_starter.V6.1/jic_shadow.cpp	2013-12-02 21:38:52.000000000 +0100
+++ src/condor_starter.V6.1/jic_shadow.cpp	2013-12-02 21:34:48.000000000 +0100
@@ -382,7 +382,7 @@
 		r2 = updateShadow( &update_ad, true );
 	}

-	return r1 || r2;
+	return (r1 && r2);
 }
remarks:
2014-Jan-17 12:28:14 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Thanks for the patch. Looks good, except in JICShadow::allJobsDone, I think we only want to consider r1(the result from parent class allJobsDone()) in our return code. I don't think a failure to update the shadow here should result in stopping the starter from exiting, because there will not be another external event. I think it should just return the status of r1, like it used to be before commit [28760] - specifically, I think this change introduced this bug in the first place.

2014-Jan-17 13:33:09 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW Looks good.
